operations.notes:
Returns current Centroids associated with the Radar at the given RP.
(For documentation purposes, a sample return is performed)

parameters.name: rp
parameters.description: the radar id (the Radar Processor unit number)

responseMessages.message: Success. See the 'Response Class' section above for the description of the data. Note that since this is a REST endpoint example, the WebSocket Header Info is not shown.

CentroidShapesRestDto.description: Shape of centroid given as array of entries (in clockwise direction) of azimuth and range start and stop

azimuthBams.description: [0-65535]: azimuth value in BAMS for given entry (0 true north. Value increases in clockwise direction. 32768 (65536/2) represents 180 degrees)

rangeStart.description: start range of cluster for the given azimuthBams (in range bins)

rangeStop.description: end range of cluster for the given azimuthBams (in range bins)

ws.description: WebSocket information provided for WebSocket delivered data

numItems.description: number of centroids in this message

radarLat.description: radar latitude in decimal degrees. Centroids are relative to this location.

radarLon.description: radar longitude in decimal degrees. Centroids are relative to this location.

metersPerRangeBin.description: meters per range bin (used to convert range-bin fields (such as clusterRangeBin) to meters)

rp.description: [1-64]: the resource identifier; the radar id (the Radar Processor unit number)

notHeartbeating.description: [0,1] this field indicates the state of the system. If 1 then indicates there is no Heartbeat and it is very unlikely to have data. If missing (or 0) then indicates there is a Heartbeat, and data is expected (if the Radar is radiating)

clusterAzimuthBam.description: [0-65535]: azimuth of the cluster in BAMS (0 true north. value increases in clockwise direction. 32768 (65536/2) represents 180 degrees)

shape.description: array of centroid data which forms a centroid shape

send_time.description: time in epoch milliseconds the data was sent from MIS

sequenceNum.description: sequence number of data for this URL. This increases by 1 per message, but won't necessarily start at 1.
